no_more_50_words: Resturants will often have deep friers, which are appliances that require cooking oil; if the restaurant is busy, the oil in the frier may require frequent replacement.
50_to_100_words: A restaurant is likely the busiest location in town that would use gallons and gallons of oil per week for deep frying because they typically serve a large volume of customers and offer a wide variety of menu items that are fried. These items may include French fries, fried chicken, onion rings, and many other popular foods. The high demand for these items means that the restaurant needs to have a large quantity of oil on hand to keep up with the frying needs. Additionally, the restaurant may need to change the oil frequently to maintain the quality of the food and ensure the safety of the customers.
